==Japanese==

===Kanji===
{{ja-kanji|grade=8|rs=木03}}

# careless
# woods; grove
# Chinese family name "Du"

====Readings====
* {{ja-readings|goon=[[ず]] (zu)|kanon=[[と]] (to)|kun=[[もり]] (mori), [[ふさぐ]] (fusagu), [[やまなし]] (yamanashi)}}

====Compounds====
* {{ja-r|杜撰|ずさん}}: [[careless]], [[slipshod]], [[faulty]]
* {{ja-r|杜松|ねず}}
* {{ja-r|杜氏|とじ}}: chief [[brewer]] at a [[sake]] [[brewery]]
* {{ja-r|杜漏|ずろう}}: [[careless]], [[negligent]]
* {{ja-r|杜絶|とぜつ}}, {{ja-r|途絶|とぜつ}}: [[stoppage]]; [[interruption]]; [[cessation]]; [[suspension]]
* {{ja-r|杜若|かきつばた}}

====Derived terms====
* {{ja-r|杜撰脱漏|ずさんだつろう}}: careless (slipshod) and with many omissions
* {{ja-r|杜の都|もり の みやこ}}: lit. City of Trees. Nickname for [[w:Sendai, Japan|Sendai, Japan]]
* {{ja-r|鎮守の杜|ちんじゅ の もり}}: [[grove]] of the [[village]] [[shrine]]

====Synonyms====
* {{ja-r|森|もり}}
* {{ja-r|途|と}}

====Usage notes====
杜 is included in a planned expansion of the general use [[w:Jōyō kanji|Jōyō kanji]] by the Japanese government.
* The Japan Times (October 21, 2009). ''[http://www.kanjiclinic.com/kc99final.htm Get set for next year's overhaul of joyo kanji].'' Accessed February 23, 2010.
